intro: Asprella purpurea, commonly known as the purple asprella, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to purple, depending on the variety. Its leaves are typically finely divided and emit a mild, spicy scent when crushed. Asprella purpurea is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and fragrant qualities.
